metadata.description:
This data set contains meteorological element observation data of heihe remote sensing station in the middle reaches of heihe hydrometeorological observation network from January 1, 2015 to December 31, 2015.The station is located in the east of dangzhai town, zhangye city, gansu province.The longitude and latitude of the observation point are 100.4756e, 38.8270n and 1560m above sea level.The air temperature and humidity sensor is located at 1.5, facing due north.The barometer is in the waterproof box;The tilting bucket rain gauge is installed at 0.7 m;The wind speed and direction sensor is located at 10m, facing due north;The installation height of the four-component radiometer is 1.5m, facing due south;The installation height of the two infrared thermometers is 1.5m, facing due south and the probe facing vertically downward.The soil temperature probe is buried at 0cm on the surface and 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm and 160cm underground.The soil water probe was buried at 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm and 160cm.Average soil temperature probes were buried in 2cm and 4cm;The soil heat flow plate (3 pieces) is buried 6cm underground.Two photosynthetically active radiometers were set up 1.5m above the canopy (one probe vertically upwards and one probe vertically downwards), facing due south.Steam dishes were also observed (E601B, diameter 61.8cm).
Observation projects are: air temperature and humidity (Ta_1. 5 m, RH_1. 5 m) (unit: c, percentage), pressure (Press) (unit: hundred mpa), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), wind speed (WS_10m) (unit: m/s), wind (WD_10m) (unit: degrees), the radiation of four component (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts per square meter), the surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit:C), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (in watts/m2), soil temperature (Ts_0cm, Ts_2cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_20cm, Ts_40cm, Ts_80cm, Ts_120cm, Ts_160cm) (in:Degrees Celsius), soil moisture (Ms_0cm Ms_2cm Ms_4cm, Ms_10cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_80cm, Ms_120cm, Ms_160cm) (unit: c), up and down photosynthetic active radiation (PAR_U_up, PAR_U_down) (unit: second micromoles/m2), the average soil temperature (TCAV) (unit: c), the evaporating dish in the depth of the water, the depth (unit: mm).
Processing and quality control of observed data :(1) ensure 144 pieces of data every day (every 10min), and mark by -6999 in case of data missing;Data missing due to power supply problems;Due to collector problem, many observation elements have more error values;(2) excluding the time with duplicate records;(3) data that obviously exceeds the physical significance or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked with red letter in the data is the data in question;(5) date and time have the same format, and date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: June 10, 2015, 10:30;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.
For information of hydrometeorological network or station, please refer to Liu et al. (2018), and for observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al. (2011).
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2015年1月1日至2015年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网中游黑河遥感站气象要素观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市党寨镇东侧，下垫面是人工草地。观测点的经纬度是100.4756E, 38.8270N，海拔1560m。空气温度湿度传感器架设在1.5处，朝向正北；气压计在防水箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在0.7 m处；风速风向传感器架设在10m处，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装高度为1.5m，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装高度为1.5m，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处；土壤水分探头埋设在2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处；平均土壤温度探头埋设在2cm和4cm；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处；两个光合有效辐射仪分别架设在冠层上方1.5m（探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个），朝向正南。同时有蒸发皿的观测（E601B，直径61.8cm）。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_1.5m、RH_1.5m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_80cm、Ts_120cm、Ts_160cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_0cm、Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_80cm、Ms_120cm、Ms_160cm）(单位：摄氏度)、向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_U_up、PAR_U_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)、平均土壤温度（TCAV）（单位：摄氏度）、蒸发皿内水深（depth）（单位: mm）。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；2015.6.05-6.09和10.16-11.11由于供电问题，数据缺失；2015.12.19-12.31由于采集器问题，很多观测要素出现较多的错误值；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2015-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“冠层上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在冠层内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过冠层顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型包含所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射仪视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层），并与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果进行了比较。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，当EC通量测量的潜热（LE）和感热（H）与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在能量平衡闭合不完全时，这一任务变得更加困难。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这一温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的现象。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，具体是通过观察到的E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估计蒸散发（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡动相关（EC）测量更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还因为在灌溉农田中，当平均H较小时，EC系统的不确定性达到了18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，通过冠层的入射短波和长波辐射透射率的估计不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的气温、风速和湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用10 Hz采样频率的EC系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔上25米高的平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天07:00至19:00期间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）来计算。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区是一个人工绿洲，覆盖着玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，与EC系统的测量值相比，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组分温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估算的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估算也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的上尺度化是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个涡度协方差（EC）塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖了FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就一直是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，先前的研究发现，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，以及风速和风向的梯度；空气压力、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行观测，同时还记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you give an example of a dataset that includes multiscale and multidisciplinary data for studying oasis–desert interactions?

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the significance of using four-component radiometers in hydrometeorological data collection?
Definition.QuestionCn: 使用四分量辐射计在水文气象数据收集中的重要性是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: Four-component radiometers are used to measure radiations at different heights above the ground, crucial for calculating net radiation, which is a key component in energy balance studies. They provide detailed data on incoming and outgoing shortwave and longwave radiation, essential for understanding energy dynamics in eco-hydrological experiments.
Definition.AnswerCn: 四分量辐射计用于测量地面不同高度的辐射，对于计算净辐射至关重要，这是能量平衡研究中的一个关键组成部分。它们提供了关于入射和出射短波辐射及长波辐射的详细数据，这对于理解生态水文实验中的能量动态至关重要。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do data collection methods for soil temperature and moisture in the 黑河生态水文遥感试验 compare with those used in the HiWATER experiment?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验中土壤温度和湿度的数据收集方法与HiWATER实验中使用的方法有何比较？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In the 黑河生态水文遥感试验, soil temperature and moisture are measured using probes buried at various depths from 0 cm to 160 cm, with specific metrics being collected for each layer. In the HiWATER experiment, soil moisture data are part of an eco-hydrological sensor network, suggesting a broader integration with other ecological measurements. Both experiments emphasize detailed soil parameter collection, but HiWATER incorporates additional multiscale and multidisciplinary data for comprehensive ecosystem analysis.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在黑河生态水文遥感试验中，土壤温度和湿度通过埋在0厘米到160厘米不同深度的探头进行测量，并为每个层次收集特定指标。在HiWATER实验中，土壤湿度数据是生态水文传感器网络的一部分，表明与其他生态测量的更广泛整合。这两个实验都强调详细的土壤参数收集，但HiWATER结合了额外的多尺度和多学科数据，以进行全面的生态系统分析。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the similarities and differences in the challenges faced in data collection between the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model and oasis–desert system studies?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在两源能量平衡（TSEB）模型和绿洲–沙漠系统研究中，数据收集面临的挑战有哪些相似之处和不同之处？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Both the TSEB model and oasis–desert system studies face challenges related to accurately measuring and interpreting data in heterogeneous landscapes. The TSEB model struggles with separating soil and vegetation temperatures and accounting for strong advective environments, while oasis–desert studies are hindered by the lack of multiscale observations and ecological degradation issues. However, the TSEB model is more focused on improving temperature separation techniques, whereas oasis–desert studies emphasize sustaining ecological stability and carbon balance.
Comparison.AnswerCn: TSEB模型和绿洲-沙漠系统研究在异质景观中准确测量和解释数据方面面临挑战。TSEB模型在分离土壤和植被温度以及考虑强对流环境方面存在困难，而绿洲-沙漠研究则受到缺乏多尺度观测和生态退化问题的困扰。然而，TSEB模型更专注于改善温度分离技术，而绿洲-沙漠研究则强调维持生态稳定性和碳平衡。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it difficult to achieve accurate component temperature separation in arid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，实现准确的组件温度分离是困难的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Accurate component temperature separation in arid regions is difficult due to image classification errors that vary with vegetation abundance, which can result in soil pixels being misclassified as vegetation pixels. This leads to an overestimation of canopy temperatures. Additionally, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance, as well as uncertainties in estimating incoming radiation transmittances through the canopy, can impact temperature estimates.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，准确的组件温度分离是困难的，因为图像分类错误会随着植被丰度的变化而变化，这可能导致土壤像素被误分类为植被像素。这会导致对冠层温度的高估。此外，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率，以及在估算通过冠层的入射辐射透射率时的不确定性，都会影响温度估计。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the primary reasons for the poor availability of multiscale observations in eco-hydrological studies?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 生态水文研究中多尺度观测可用性差的主要原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The poor availability of multiscale observations in eco-hydrological studies is primarily due to the challenges in instrumentation and data collection at hierarchically nested scales. Complex environments, such as oasis-desert systems, require a comprehensive observation network that includes flux observation matrices, eco-hydrological sensors, and remote sensing data, which are difficult to establish and maintain, especially over extended periods and diverse landscapes.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 生态水文研究中多尺度观测的稀缺性主要是由于在分层嵌套尺度上仪器和数据收集的挑战。复杂环境，如绿洲-沙漠系统，需要一个综合的观测网络，包括通量观测矩阵、生态水文传感器和遥感数据，这些在建立和维护上都很困难，尤其是在广泛的时间跨度和多样的地貌上。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of applying multi-scale data collection techniques to the understanding of oasis-desert interactions in eco-hydrological research?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 应用多尺度数据收集技术来理解绿洲-沙漠相互作用在生态水文学研究中的潜在后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Applying multi-scale data collection techniques in eco-hydrological research can enhance the understanding of oasis-desert interactions by providing comprehensive insights into energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange processes. This approach allows for a more detailed capture of eco-hydrological processes across different spatial and temporal scales, which is crucial for addressing the challenge of limited multi-scale observations and supporting sustainable oasis development.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 在生态水文研究中应用多尺度数据收集技术可以增强对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的理解，提供对能量、水汽和碳交换过程的全面洞察。这种方法能够更详细地捕捉不同空间和时间尺度上的生态水文过程，这对于应对有限的多尺度观测挑战以及支持可持续的绿洲发展至关重要。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the effects of integrating ground-based measurements and remote sensing data on the accuracy of energy and water vapor exchange estimation in oasis-desert areas?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 将地面测量与遥感数据相结合对绿洲-沙漠地区能量和水汽交换估计的准确性有什么影响？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating ground-based measurements with remote sensing data can significantly improve the accuracy of energy and water vapor exchange estimation in oasis-desert areas. This combination allows for cross-validation and refinement of data, leading to more reliable estimates of fluxes and better understanding of the interactions between oasis and desert systems, which is vital for ecological stability and sustainable development.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 将地面测量与遥感数据相结合，可以显著提高绿洲-沙漠地区能量和水汽交换估算的准确性。这种结合允许进行交叉验证和数据的精细化，从而导致更可靠的通量估算，并更好地理解绿洲与沙漠系统之间的相互作用，这对生态稳定性和可持续发展至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to develop goal-oriented data collection methods for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么开发以目标为导向的数据收集方法对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换至关重要？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis-desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of these exchanges is crucial to recognize oasis-desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展至关重要。对这些交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用具有重要意义，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展也至关重要；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the implications of collecting multiscale and multidisciplinary data for modeling evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 收集多尺度和多学科数据对建模异质土地表面的蒸散发具有哪些影响？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The implications of collecting multiscale and multidisciplinary data lie in addressing the challenge of upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces, as poor availability of multiscale observations hinders progress in this field. The HiWATER experiment is designed to tackle this challenge through hierarchically nested scales to obtain comprehensive data, which are essential for understanding the interactions between oasis and desert systems and for improving models like the TSEB model in accurately estimating evapotranspiration components.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 收集多尺度和多学科数据的意义在于解决在异质表面上提升生态水文过程的挑战，因为多尺度观测的缺乏阻碍了该领域的进展。HiWATER实验旨在通过分层嵌套的尺度来应对这一挑战，以获取全面的数据，这对于理解绿洲与沙漠系统之间的相互作用以及改进像TSEB模型这样的模型在准确估计蒸散发组成部分方面至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: How does the integration of various observational datasets contribute to addressing the challenges faced by inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 各种观测数据集的整合如何有助于应对干旱和半干旱地区内陆河流流域面临的挑战？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Integration of various observational datasets contributes by providing long-term data on energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes, and auxiliary hydrometeorological data. This comprehensive data collection is crucial for addressing the ecological environment degradation challenges faced by inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas, such as river and lake drying, vegetation degradation, land desertification, and dust storms. These datasets support the recognition of oasis-desert interactions and help maintain ecological stability and promote sustainable development in these regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 各种观测数据集的整合通过提供能源、水汽、碳和甲烷通量以及辅助水文气象数据的长期数据，发挥了重要作用。这种全面的数据收集对于应对内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临的生态环境退化挑战至关重要，例如河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化、土地沙漠化和沙尘暴。这些数据集支持对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的认识，并有助于维护生态稳定，促进这些地区的可持续发展。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are used to ensure quality control and data preprocessing for hydrometeorological datasets collected in oasis-desert ecological systems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 确保在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中收集的水文气象数据集的质量控制和数据预处理所使用的程序是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Data quality control in hydrometeorological datasets involves ensuring daily data completeness with 144 data points every 10 minutes, marking missing data with -6999, removing duplicate records, eliminating physically unrealistic or instrumentally out-of-range data, and marking questionable data in red. The data is formatted with consistent date and time, and follows specific naming conventions. Additionally, datasets undergo quality control through sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and dataset generation.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 水文气象数据集的数据质量控制涉及确保每日数据的完整性，每10分钟有144个数据点，用-6999标记缺失数据，删除重复记录，消除物理上不合理或仪器超出范围的数据，并将可疑数据标记为红色。数据格式具有一致的日期和时间，并遵循特定的命名约定。此外，数据集通过传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成进行质量控制。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How is a multi-scale observation system designed to study eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous land surfaces?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 多尺度观测系统是如何设计的，以研究异质土地表面的生态水文过程？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: A multi-scale observation system is structured using hierarchically nested scales involving a sparse network to investigate oasis-desert interactions, a superstation within the oasis, and several EC towers and automatic meteorological stations across different landscapes. Intensive observations are made at the irrigation district scale, supported by airborne remote sensing missions using LiDAR, imaging spectrometry, thermal imaging, and microwave radiometry.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 一个多尺度观测系统采用分层嵌套的尺度结构，利用稀疏网络研究绿洲-沙漠相互作用，在绿洲内设有超级站，以及在不同景观中布置了多个生态系统塔和自动气象站。在灌溉区尺度上进行密集观测，支持的手段包括使用激光雷达、成像光谱、热成像和微波辐射计的航空遥感任务。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What instruments and methodologies are employed to measure energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，测量能量、水蒸气和碳交换所采用的仪器和方法包括：
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To measure energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, instruments such as eddy covariance systems, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic weather stations are used. These measure parameters like turbulent fluxes, radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, air temperature and humidity gradients, wind speed and direction, and groundwater data. Additional datasets include vegetation and soil parameters, complemented by remote sensing data from LiDAR and other imaging technologies.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了测量能量、水汽和碳交换，使用了涡度协方差系统、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站等仪器。这些仪器测量诸如湍流通量、辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向以及地下水数据等参数。其他数据集包括植被和土壤参数，并辅以来自LiDAR和其他成像技术的遥感数据。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have enabled the collection of multiscale eco-hydrological data in oasis-desert areas?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在绿洲-沙漠地区收集多尺度生态水文数据成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Technological advancements such as the use of LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, and L-band microwave radiometers have enabled the collection of multiscale eco-hydrological data, allowing for comprehensive and hierarchical observations of eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert areas.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 技术进步，如激光雷达（LiDAR）、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计，使得能够收集多尺度的生态水文数据，从而在绿洲-沙漠地区对生态水文过程进行全面和分层的观察。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do ground-based measurement techniques enable the validation of evapotranspiration models in strongly advective agricultural areas?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 地面测量技术如何在强烈的平流农业区域中验证蒸散发模型？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Ground-based measurement techniques such as the eddy covariance system and thermal infrared cameras enable the validation of evapotranspiration models by providing accurate soil and canopy component temperatures and latent heat flux measurements, which are crucial for estimating evaporation and transpiration in strongly advective agricultural areas.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 地面测量技术，如涡度协方差系统和热红外相机，通过提供准确的土壤和冠层温度以及潜热通量测量，能够验证蒸散发模型，这对于在强烈的平流农业区域估算蒸发和蒸腾至关重要。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What data quality control measures enable the reliable collection and processing of hydrometeorological observations in arid regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些数据质量控制措施能够确保在干旱地区可靠地收集和处理水文气象观测数据？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Data quality control measures such as sensor calibration, careful data collection, processing, and archiving enable the reliable collection and processing of hydrometeorological observations in arid regions, ensuring accuracy and consistency in datasets involving energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 数据质量控制措施，如传感器校准、仔细的数据收集、处理和归档，确保在干旱地区可靠地收集和处理水文气象观测数据，从而确保涉及能量、水汽和碳交换的数据集的准确性和一致性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might challenges arise in measuring evapotranspiration accurately in arid regions using remote sensing methodologies?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区使用遥感方法准确测量蒸散发可能会出现哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Challenges in measuring evapotranspiration accurately in arid regions with remote sensing methodologies may arise due to the difficulty in separating soil and canopy temperatures in heterogeneous landscapes, as well as errors from image classification and uncertainties in atmospheric radiation transmittance estimates.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，使用遥感方法准确测量蒸散发面临的挑战包括在异质景观中难以分离土壤和冠层温度，以及图像分类中的错误和大气辐射透过率估计的不确定性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the potential reasons for the difficulty in acquiring multiscale observations of eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，获取生态水文过程的多尺度观测的困难潜在原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The difficulty in acquiring multiscale observations of eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert ecosystems is often due to the limited availability of comprehensive data collection systems that can integrate measurements across different spatial and temporal scales, as well as the complexity of capturing interactions between diverse landscapes like oases and deserts.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，获取生态水文过程的多尺度观测的困难，往往是由于缺乏能够整合不同空间和时间尺度测量的综合数据收集系统，以及捕捉绿洲和沙漠等多样化景观之间相互作用的复杂性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your assessment of the challenges associated with data collection in arid and semiarid regions, particularly in terms of obtaining multiscale observations?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对干旱和半干旱地区数据收集所面临的挑战的评估，特别是在获取多尺度观测方面。
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Data collection in arid and semiarid regions faces significant challenges due to the harsh environmental conditions and limited availability of multiscale observations. These challenges include maintaining instrument functionality in extreme temperatures, capturing the dynamic interactions between oases and deserts, and ensuring consistent data coverage across varied spatial scales. The lack of multiscale observations hampers the comprehensive understanding of eco-hydrological processes.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，数据收集面临着由于恶劣环境条件和多尺度观测有限而带来的重大挑战。这些挑战包括在极端温度下保持仪器的功能、捕捉绿洲与沙漠之间的动态相互作用，以及确保在不同空间尺度上数据覆盖的一致性。缺乏多尺度观测阻碍了对生态水文过程的全面理解。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data collection methods ensure accuracy when measuring soil and canopy temperatures in diverse landscapes.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白数据收集方法如何确保在多样化景观中测量土壤和树冠温度的准确性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The data collection method involves using a high-resolution thermal camera to measure soil and canopy component temperatures. These temperatures are derived from thermal images and are validated against surface radiometric temperatures calculated using long-wave radiation data from a four-component radiometer. Classification of soil and canopy pixels using visible and NIR images helps in accurately determining component temperatures.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法涉及使用高分辨率热像仪测量土壤和冠层组件的温度。这些温度是通过热图像得出的，并与使用四组件辐射计计算的表面辐射温度进行验证。使用可见光和近红外图像对土壤和冠层像素进行分类，有助于准确确定组件温度。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how the separation of evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration is achieved using isotopic techniques.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解如何通过同位素技术将蒸散作用分为蒸发和植物蒸腾。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The separation is achieved by using stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes to validate the ratios of evaporation (E) and transpiration (T) to total evapotranspiration (ET). Ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures aid in the estimation, and eddy covariance systems provide additional measurements to refine the partitioning process. The isotopic techniques offer a reliable method for validating the component estimates of E and T.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 分离是通过使用稳定的氧和氢同位素来验证蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）与总蒸散（ET）之间的比率来实现的。地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度有助于估算，而涡度协方差系统提供额外的测量以完善分配过程。同位素技术为验证E和T的组分估算提供了一种可靠的方法。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore the challenges associated with multiscale observations in oasis-desert ecosystems and suggest potential strategies for overcoming them.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中与多尺度观测相关的挑战，并提出克服这些挑战的潜在策略。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: One of the main challenges in multiscale observations in oasis-desert ecosystems is the poor availability of multiscale observations, which hinders progress in understanding eco-hydrological processes. To address this, the HiWATER experiment was designed to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales. Instruments such as a flux observation matrix, eco-hydrological sensor networks, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing were used. These strategies, including the arrangement of instruments in hierarchically nested scales and intensive observation periods, help capture the complex interactions and processes across different scales.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统的多尺度观测中，主要挑战之一是多尺度观测的可用性差，这阻碍了对生态水文过程的理解。为了解决这个问题，HiWATER实验被设计用来通过在层次嵌套尺度上布置仪器来获取多尺度和多学科的数据。使用了如通量观测矩阵、生态水文传感器网络和超高分辨率航空遥感等仪器。这些策略，包括在层次嵌套尺度上布置仪器和密集观测期，有助于捕捉不同尺度之间复杂的相互作用和过程。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please discuss the quality control measures implemented during the data collection phase of hydrometeorological observations in the Heihe River Basin and their importance.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请讨论在黑河流域水文气象观测数据收集阶段实施的质量控制措施及其重要性。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection phase of hydrometeorological observations in the Heihe River Basin included quality control measures such as sensor calibration, data processing, and dataset generation to ensure the reliability of the data collected. Observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout these stages to provide accurate and consistent data that support the understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems. These quality control measures are crucial for ensuring that the data can be reliably used for scientific analysis and modeling, which is essential for achieving the goals of sustainable oasis development and ecological stability.
